pkgmetadata.longdescription: Two-Part Estimation of Treatment Rules for Semi-Continuous Data // Implements the methodology of Huling, Smith, and Chen (2020) doi:10.1080/01621459.2020.1801449, which allows for subgroup identification for semi-continuous outcomes by estimating individualized treatment rules. It uses a two-part modeling framework to handle semi-continuous data by separately modeling the positive part of the outcome and an indicator of whether each outcome is positive, but still results in a single treatment rule. High dimensional data is handled with a cooperative lasso penalty, which encourages the coefficients in the two models to have the same sign.
